The Science & Story Behind It

This cultivar is made possible by contemporary research and selective breeding:

  • Unlike its semi-aquatic ancestor, ‘Hydro-Pepper’ is a true hydrophyte, possessing specialized air channels (aerenchyma) that allow it to be fully submerged without rot, absorbing all necessary nutrients directly from the water.
  • The intense peppery flavour comes from high concentrations of gluconasturtiin, a glucosinolate that converts to the sharp phenethyl isothiocyanate when the leaves are damaged (chewed or cut) - a potent, natural defence mechanism that we experience as flavour.
  • By growing it in a controlled aquatic system, we eliminate the risk of contamination from the parasite Fasciola hepatica (liver fluke), a concern sometimes associated with wild-harvested watercress from open streams.

In short, Dwarf Watercress ‘Hydro-Pepper’ is a bio-optimized aquatic green that delivers a consistently intense, clean, and safe peppery flavour, bringing the essence of a freshwater spring directly to your urban kitchen.
